meanings.definition: A musical rhythm in which strong beats are replaced by weak beats.
meanings.sent1: The jazz band played with syncopation, making the music sound unique.
meanings.sent2: The drummer added syncopation to the song, creating a lively beat.
meanings.sent3: The syncopation in the song made everyone want to dance in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her heart danced to the syncopation of the music, like a secret rhythm only she could hear.
meanings.sent5: The syncopation of the drums echoed through the room, leaving a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The act of syncopating a musical rhythm.
meanings.sent1: The syncopation of the music was carefully planned by the composer.
meanings.sent2: She practiced the syncopation of the song until it was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The syncopation of the melody added a playful twist to the performance.
meanings.sent4: His fingers moved with syncopation across the piano keys, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The syncopation of the notes seemed to dance off the sheet music, bringing the piece to life.
